availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Freeman F. Runyon. Jr. (Madison County, medical student, farmer, and soldier)

body.p: Madison County, Kentucky, medical student, farmer, and soldier. Madison County native. Son of Freeman F. Runyon and Amanda Farris Runyon. Grandson of Absalom Runyon and Mary Runyon. Resident in Todd County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned five enslaved persons in Todd County in 1850. Medical student in Madison County in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Madison County in 1860. Served in the 3rd Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as private from December 13, 1861, to May 5, 1862. Died by suicide at Shiloh, Tennessee on May 5, 1862.
